sentence.Network_en: We need a factotum to take care of the workshop.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们需要一个杂役来负责车间的事情。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (originally in the phrases dominum (or magister) factotum, translating roughly as 'master of everything', and Johannes factotem 'John do-it-all' or 'Jack of all trades'): from medieval Latin, from Latin fac! 'do!' (imperative of facere) + totum 'the whole thing' (neuter of totus)

entry.def: A factotum is a servant who is employed to do a wide variety of jobs for someone.

means.word_mean: 1. a servant employed to do a variety of jobs
